instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3H: What is PP5V_G3H? PP5V_G3H is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi there,

i have an Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which had a Water Damage. I have already changed <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> because it had a short on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.
When i Changed <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> i might have ripped of the <SIGNAL>TP_UPC_XA_DBG_UART_TX</SIGNAL> Pin. But i couldnt find it anywhere else on the Boardview. Is this Pin doing anything?

After i have Changed those two chips i read the following Voltages:

<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL>:5.20V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL>:3.0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL>:0.2V / 6.62KOhms
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>:0V /4.55KOhms

What i Noticed is that i dont have <RESISTOR>R3061</RESISTOR>. It was missing from when i started trying to repair it.
Can you help me out with this?

Greetings from Germany

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R3061</RESISTOR> is "NO STUFF" so it is supposed to be missing.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> should be there. <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> present? <SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_P5V0</SIGNAL> present? Any shorts around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Thanks for the quick reply.

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> is at 5.20V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_LDO_P5V0</SIGNAL> is at 5.0V
Around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> i couldnt find a full short but on <CAPACITOR>C7966</CAPACITOR> i measured on the <SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0</SIGNAL> Pin 193Ohms to ground which seems a bit low.

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is generated by <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and should be present. Do you have a power supply to inject 3v3 and monitor the current? If <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is dead you have a problem as you can only take it from a donor board, the new ones don't work!

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> also present?

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I will try that, but before i do so i want to confirm the following. I noticed I also dont have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Am i right with the assumption that this has to be there before I can even get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL>?
I measure only 1.4mV and 3.8KOhms to ground for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. The Line has a Capacitance of 1mF. Now Feeling a bit stupid for not measuring this in the first place.
Is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> also generated in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is at 0.002mV

I hope its not <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> because harvesting and reballing this from an Aliexpress Board seems like my personal hell.
This one wouldnt work? [URL]https://store.rossmanngroup.com/e8-isl95530hiz.html[/URL]

Also is it ok to have only 11 Ohms to Ground on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> on this Board?

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I tried injecting 3.3 Volts. The <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> Line pulled about 50mA from the Power Supply. I couldnt find anything that gets warm.
I also tried inserting 8.6 Volts to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. When I did this i successfully got <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL>.
I Get 0.2-0.3MOhms to Ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
Do I see correct that <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> only Generates <SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT1</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT2</SIGNAL> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7020</TRANSISTOR> makes this <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> which then flows to the System and also back to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
Or is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> also being created directly inside of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Because i am getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT1</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT2</SIGNAL> (both at 4.7V). Wouldnt that mean i either have a Problem with <TRANSISTOR>Q7020</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> or with the Circuitry around it?

I have Plugged in the USB C Charger again and the Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> slowly (About 5 Minutes) rises from nothing up to 0.7 Volts when adding a bit of Alcohol on the Board. When its evaporated it decreases again. Should i try a reflow of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> present? The issue is probably around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. The problem if <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is dead you need a donor :(

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is at 0.002mV when using the USB-C Charger. Or do you mean when i Inject <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
I will try a reflow on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> if that doesnt´t work i will order a donor board from Aliexpress or does the Chip here Work? [URL]https://store.rossmanngroup.com/e8-isl95530hiz.html[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: ACOK should be present when charger is connected. You are using an original Apple charger and USB-C cable I hope? No messing with Chinese crap there!

threads.title: Macbook 12inch <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> No <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes it is an original charger. But I currently dont have another device to test if the charger itself is ok or if it has been killed with the dead <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>. But at least it delivers the 5.20V on <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL>.
I guess I will try my luck with reflowing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. If that doesnt work i will order a donor board from Aliexpress.


Okay it didnt work. Do you know where i could find a stencil that fits to reball this chip?
